BSides Roanoke 2026

An annual regional cybersecurity conference.

About

Join us for a day of learning, networking, and fun as we explore the latest trends in cybersecurity.

Schedule

  • Opening Ceremonies at 9:00 AM
  • Keynote at 10:00 AM
  • Ethical AI in Cybersecurity: Balancing Innovation and Responsibility (2:00 PM - 3:00 PM)
  • Building Cyber Resilience in Critical Infrastructure (3:30 PM - 4:30 PM)
  • Breakout sessions throughout the day

Speakers

  • John Doe - Senior Security Engineer
  • Jane Smith - Quantum Computing Researcher
  • Alex Chen - Ethical AI Specialist
  • Michael Brown - Critical Infrastructure Specialist

Venue & Parking

Venue Information

Location: Roanoke Convention Center, Roanoke, VA

Address: 710 Williamson Rd NE, Roanoke, VA 24016

Date: October 24, 2026

Parking & Transportation

Parking

  • Complimentary parking available on-site
  • Additional parking available at the Roanoke Civic Center Garage
  • Street parking available in surrounding areas

Public Transportation

  • Bus Routes: Multiple bus routes serve the convention center area
  • Shuttle Service: Free shuttle service from major hotels
  • Rideshare: Uber and Lyft service available

Accessibility

  • Wheelchair accessible facilities
  • ADA compliant entrances and restrooms
  • Sign language interpreters available upon request

Featured Talks from June 4, 2026

10:00 AM - 11:00 AMMain Hall

Ethical AI in Cybersecurity: Balancing Innovation and Responsibility

Abstract:Examining the ethical implications of AI in cybersecurity and best practices for responsible implementation.

11:30 AM - 12:30 PMRoom C

Building Cyber Resilience in Critical Infrastructure

Abstract:Strategies for protecting critical infrastructure from cyber attacks and ensuring rapid recovery.

Featured Speakers

John Doe

Senior Security Engineer

John is a seasoned security professional with over 15 years of experience in penetration testing, threat hunting, and incident response.

Alex Chen

Ethical AI Specialist

Alex focuses on the ethical implications of artificial intelligence in cybersecurity and helps organizations implement responsible AI practices.

Jane Smith

Quantum Computing Researcher

Jane is a leading expert in quantum computing and its applications to cybersecurity. She has published numerous papers on post-quantum cryptography.

Michael Brown

Critical Infrastructure Specialist

Michael focuses on protecting critical infrastructure from cyber threats and helps organizations develop resilience strategies.

Sara Miller

IoT Security Specialist

Sara specializes in securing Internet of Things (IoT) devices and networks, helping organizations protect their IoT ecosystems from emerging threats.
